hi

#bitcoin-core-dev Meeting: abubakarsadiq achow101 _aj_ ajonas b10c brunoerg cfields darosior dergoegge fanquake fjahr furszy gleb glozow hebasto instagibbs jarolrod jonatack josibake kanzure laanwj LarryRuane lightlike luke-jr maflcko marcofleon maxedw Murch pinheadmz provoostenator ryanofsky sdaftuar S3RK stickies-v sipa sr_gi tdb3 theStack TheCharlatan vasild willcl-ark
hi
hi
hi
hi
hi
hi
I see one topic for today. Anything to add?
hi
#topic Erlay WG Update (sr_gi, gleb, marcofleon)
hi
I've been updating the approach for the current Erlay PR. Pushed the changes yesterday (#30116)
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/30116 | p2p: Fill reconciliation sets (Erlay) attempt 2 by sr-gi · Pull Request #30116 · bitcoin/bitcoin · GitHub
hi
hi
And I'm currently rebasing the full Erlay implementation on top of it #30277
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/30277 | [DO NOT MERGE] Erlay: bandwidth-efficient transaction relay protocol (Full implementation) by sr-gi · Pull Request #30277 · bitcoin/bitcoin · GitHub
The goal is making sure this runs as expected to start running Warnet simulations
So if anyone is interested on the newest approach, take a look at 30116
That's it for now, hope I can share some interesting results in the following weeks once we start running experiments with actual nodes
#topic Kernel WG Update (TheCharlatan)
Had some more discussions on the long-term maintainability of having a C header API for the bitcoinkernel library in #30595.
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/30595 | kernel: Introduce initial C header API by TheCharlatan · Pull Request #30595 · bitcoin/bitcoin · GitHub
Debate is still if a c++ header might be the better choice after all

Thanks to some quick reviews we now also have a simple functional test for bitcoin-chainstate, which could make it a bit easier to ensure the library is actually usable and to validate future changes to the API.
I am still waiting for more reviews on #31382. It is useful, because it cleans up the shutdown logic a bit and gets rid of the last remaining warts in bitcoin-chainstate.
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/31382 | kernel: Flush in ChainstateManager destructor by TheCharlatan · Pull Request #31382 · bitcoin/bitcoin · GitHub
an C API is extremely useful for dynamic loading from non-C++ languages, but it could be done the other way around, wrapping the C++ one i guess
laanwj can you add a comment about that to 30595?
sure
#topic QML GUI WG Update (jarolrod, johnny9dev)
The first iteration of the Send form was merged this week. bitcoin-core/gui-qml#445
https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui-qml/issues/445 | Introduce Send pages for singlesig, single input/output send by johnny9 · Pull Request #445 · bitcoin-core/gui-qml · GitHub
The first iteration of the Coin Selection menu PR was opened. bitcoin-core/gui-qml#448
https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui-qml/issues/448 | Introduce Coin Selection page by johnny9 · Pull Request #448 · bitcoin-core/gui-qml · GitHub

Christoph has opened a design discussion on Coin Selection at https://github.com/BitcoinDesign/Bitcoin-Core-App/issues/153 and Michael has provided a nice updated prototype. I encourage anyone interested in Coin Control to take a look and leave a comment if there is anything you would like to see.
My plans for the next week are to open up a PR for the multiple recipients form as well as get bitcoin-core/gui-qml#441 and bitcoin-core/gui-qml#434 merged.
https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui-qml/issues/441 | Rename Block Clock to Block Status by johnny9 · Pull Request #441 · bitcoin-core/gui-qml · GitHub
https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui-qml/issues/434 | Move various state computations from the UI to the NodeModel by jarolrod · Pull Request #434 · bitcoin-core/gui-qml · GitHub
#topic Script Validation WG Update (fjahr)

#31689 has been merged and I am currently working on adding tests for #29491 which has seen some discussion on the approach. Happy to get more eyes on it so that we know early enough if we want changes to the secp API.
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/31689 | Benchmark Chainstate::ConnectBlock duration by Eunovo · Pull Request #31689 · bitcoin/bitcoin · GitHub
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/29491 | [EXPERIMENTAL] Schnorr batch verification for blocks by fjahr · Pull Request #29491 · bitcoin/bitcoin · GitHub
That's it from me.
furszy: did you have wallet updates?
#topic Cluster Mempool WG Update (sdaftuar, sipa)
hi
the first txgraph PR, #31363 got merged, hurray
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/31363 | cluster mempool: introduce TxGraph by sipa · Pull Request #31363 · bitcoin/bitcoin · GitHub
hi
next one in line adds support for feerate diagram comparisons, block building, and eviction: #31444
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/31444 | cluster mempool: add txgraph diagrams/mining/eviction by sipa · Pull Request #31444 · bitcoin/bitcoin · GitHub
i've also opened #32151 with a few small follow-ups
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/32151 | Follow-ups for txgraph #31363 by sipa · Pull Request #32151 · bitcoin/bitcoin · GitHub
on the research front, i've implemented the min-cut based algorithm from the 1989 paper, which seems to work very well (10s of microseconds for all our "hard" clusters in the benchmark)

if the paper, and my implementation of it, is correct, it has O(n^3) complexity, though the worst cases are still ~100x slower than our actual benchmarks, so worst case runtimes would be in the milliseconds range
lots of open questions, but very promising
that's it for me
glozow: Only legacy wallet removal update is #32149 finding. Other than that, #31250 still needs a rebase.
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/32149 | wallet, migration: Fix empty wallet crash by pablomartin4btc · Pull Request #32149 · bitcoin/bitcoin · GitHub
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/31250 | wallet: Disable creating and loading legacy wallets by achow101 · Pull Request #31250 · bitcoin/bitcoin · GitHub
furszy: thanks
#topic Stratum v2 WG Update (sjors)
Not much changed since last week, mostly hoping to see multiprocess stuff landing soon
Particularly #31741
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/31741 | multiprocess: Add libmultiprocess git subtree by ryanofsky · Pull Request #31741 · bitcoin/bitcoin · GitHub
are we blocked on #31992 there?
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/31992 | cmake: Avoid fuzzer "multiple definition of `main'" errors by ryanofsky · Pull Request #31992 · bitcoin/bitcoin · GitHub
Not really, I could drop it from 31741 if needed. 31992 is just needed to enable more checks in CI
#topic 29.0 release
Reminder to test rc2
Anything else to discuss?
i proposed a topic
oh yes sorry, I even had it written here
#topic Snap and bitcoin.org stuck on 27.x (sipa)
hi, i noticed that for unrelated reasons, both our snap package and the bitcoin.org website are stuck on 27.x releases
i see there is https://github.com/bitcoin-core/packaging/pull/248 now to update snap to 28.x, so it seems there is work on that front
just wanted to bring this to people's attention
there is https://github.com/bitcoin-dot-org/Bitcoin.org/pull/4349 to add 28.1 to bitcoin.org too, which no activity
but not sure what can be done about it
that's it, unless people have opinions/ideas
not sure, i revoked my access to bitcoin.org long ago, and no idea who's maintaining it nowadays
last update was by cobra in january?
yeah
could try contacting cobra about it, but they're always difficult
maybe give it a shot?
sure
laanwj: thank you!
Anything else to discuss?
i'll leave a review on https://github.com/bitcoin-dot-org/Bitcoin.org/pull/4349 for more visibility/activity
it seems like 27.1, 27.2, and 28.0 were never even attempted to be PR'ed, but if these PR's don't get merged, there is little point
laanwj: thanks!
stickies-v: that seems like a good idea!
#endmeeting

laanwj: great
